intro: Anemonoides, commonly known as the meadow anemone, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, often white or pink, petal-like structures called tepals. They typically have a short, hairy stem and are found in temperate regions across the Northern Hemisphere. Anemonoides species are perennial herbs that thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Their flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
